intro: Claytonia gypsophiloides, commonly known as ghost flower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its unique appearance and ability to survive in harsh conditions make it a notable species in its habitat. Claytonia gypsophiloides is also valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
